properties.name: Allen Creek Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa29112 NW 41st Ave., Ridgefield, WA, 98642Allen Creek Farm is an exclusive producer of fresh chestnuts, dried chestnuts, chestnut flour and chestnut mixes. Using sustainable ag techniques no insecticides are used and mulch enhances the soil and retains moisture for this drought tolerant crop.

properties.name: Conway Family Farms, LLC
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa 32116 NE Dial Road, Camas, WA, 98607Conway Family Farms is a family-owned small farming enterprise located near Camas Washington. The farm produces a variety of interrelated agricultural products including, grade A raw goat milk, USDA grassfed meats, woolen stadium throws, wool yarn, goats milk soap, culinary lavender, fresh blueberries, berry preserves, propagated plants and more. The farm is dedicated to responsible stewardship of the land and promotion of small family farms through sustainable practices.

properties.name: Dee Creek Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa2402 Little Kalama River Rd., Woodland, WA, 98674Our farm is family-operated. Our products include, but are not limited to, pastured poultry (broilers and turkey), pork, lamb, veg\'s, natural soaps, and farm fresh eggs. Our goal is to build an ecologically responsible and self-sustaining farm, using natural methods and humane practices. We are pleased to offer our quality products and services to those who desire an "alternative for a more healthy lifestyle."

properties.name: Garden Delights
properties.description: Posted by SlowfoodswwaBrush Prairie, WAWe enjoy working in our gardens and flower beds, then sharing delightful edibles and crafts with you. Our main products are dried herbs and flowers. Our herbs are all natural, grown without herbicides or pesticides. From the herbs we make our signature herb blends for cooking. These blends are a great way to reduce salt in your diet and add flavor. We also make a variety craft items from herbs and flowers. All our items are hand crafted bringing individual creativity to each piece. This year we have added some new products for pets. These also include our natural herbs and other organic ingredients. They have been taste tested by our own pets, who have given them lip smacking approval. Throughout the summer we will be bringing produce from our gardens. This produce is also all natural. We are not large agricultural producers. We enjoy what we do and want to share with you as neighbors. We try to keep our prices reasonable and sometimes even lower than retail grocers. But we also know that you will not be able to find the all natural local products and produce we offer in most of the big grocery stores. So if you want some thing natural or a little creative, please see your neighbors at the Battle Ground Saturday Market in Garden Delights and Flower Delights.

properties.name: Gee Creek Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa1606 NW 215th Circle, Ridgefield, WA, 98642Certified Organic apples, mixed vegetables, garlic/onions/shallots, potatoes, herbs

properties.name: Helsing Junction Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa12013 Independence Rd., Rochester, WA, 98579Each week from mid-June to mid-October our CSA members receive a pre-packed box of seasonal vegetables, fruits and flowers all grown organically on our farm. For the past 16 years our members have received 5-10% more produce that the cost of a share depending on the productivity of the growing season. Weekly shares are brought to convenient pick-up locations in Seattle, Olympia, and Portland. We work hard at cultivating a personal relationship with our CSA members, some of whom have been members for the entire 16 years. Along with our produce boxes we provide a weekly newsletter and a page of gourmet recipes. We are located in the Independence Valley on the Chehalis river, south of Olympia, Washington. For over 18 years we’ve grown certified organic vegetables, fruits, herbs and flowers on our farm’s 50 fertile acres of bottom land soil. Since 1990 we have run a CSA program in partnership with hundreds of local residents. As one of the first and largest CSA programs in Puget Sound, we have 16 seasons of experience behind us and offer the most variety of any CSA. Treat yourself to the best organic produce available, grown by two women farmers who care about the environment and are passionate about food.

properties.name: Hidden Oasis CSA
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa5410 NE 229th Ct., Vancouver, WA, 98682, USAHidden Oasis CSA is a family owned and operated enterprise. We grow all of our produce using natural methods. We no longer use tractors or gas powered tools, thus reducing the dependence on fossil fuels. We have chosen instead to employ manual and heirloom methods of farming used by our ancestors. The goal is to promote the health of the soil, and thus the health of the produce and plants that are grown in that soil.

properties.name: Hunters' Greens
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa11116 NE 156th St., Brush Prairie, WA, 98606, USAHunters\' Greens offers CSA shares for a season beginning the first Wednesday in June and ending the last week in October. We strive to farm sustainably using no synthetic fertilizers or pesticides. Owners Diane and Jim Hunter supply all the labor on the farm. Our goal is to farm "as if everything matters", including our human, animal and plant neighbors.

properties.name: MZM Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa112 Lowery Rd., Glenoma, WA, 98336A sustainable agriculture farm organically growning, hatching, breeding and free ranged raised Chickens, Ducks, Turkeys, Goats, Steer and Bull Set up under federal and state laws, licenses and inspections. Active members of USDA, WSDA, WSFB etc Also run Randle Farmers Market

properties.name: Meadows Tilth Urban Farm

properties.name: New Heritage Farms
properties.description: Posted by SlowfoodswwaWe focus small scale farming, grass fed, and heritage breeds and rare breeds. Tamworth Pigs: A Heritage Breed - listed as Threatened. The Pasture Pig. Also known as a "bacon pig" vs a lard pig; longer and leaner. Perfect for small acerage, rated medium in size [still plenty big]. Excellent mothers, gentle dispostion, and they love to graze on pasture. Guernsey Cows: A Heritage Breed - listed as a Watch. Wonderful cows - make great family cows and nurse cows. Our first Guernsey cow raised 11 Jersey calves on her first freshening, averaging 4 at a time, for approx 4 months each. We also raise a couple Jersey cows for family milk cows. Romanov Sheep: Rare. Russian breed, a pure gene, great for crossing. Known for multiple births - as in 4 or 5 lambs/pregnancy. Easy lambing, no assistance required, great for the small farm. Crossbred daughters make perfect commercial ewes, as they will carry-on the multiple births with an average 2-3 lambs. We milk one to two cows, to raise up our Jersey calves and weaner pigs. After weaning off the bottle or cow, the Jersey calves are given a couple more months of grain to ensure a strong foundation. At approximately 6 months they are put out on pasture. For the next 18 months or so, until approximately 2 years of age, they are entirely grass fed [or hay during winter]. The Jersey meat is a fine grained meat, allowing it to be very lean and very tender at the same time. The sheep and lambs require a little grain, but are not "fed out" to fatten them artificially. They are primarily grass fed, and very sweet and mild tasting. On our property, and the property we rent, we use no pesticides. We do buy conventional grains and feeds. We medicate only to save a life. We\'ve found a worming program is necessary with our limited pasture set-up. Our customers rave about our meats. We are constantly gratified by their praises. So while we are not organic, our customers\' verify time and again, that there is a significant difference in the taste and quality of small scale grass fed animals.

properties.name: Northwest Organic Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa17713 NW 61st Ave., Ridgefield, WA, 98642, USAWe are a 7 acre certified organic farm near Portland, Oregon. We grow garlic and Heirloom tomatoes. We have a farm fest every September. Always open to visitors.

properties.description: Posted by SlowfoodswwaBattle Ground, WA, 98604, USAOld Town Saturday Market located in charming Old Town Battle Ground on East Main Street between Old Town Battlegrounds coffee house and Value Giant ! Hours are 9-3 every Saturday. We are very down home on what we offer, very locally grown and crafted. WIC and Senior Food Nutrition Program produce vouchers are accepted at our market!

properties.name: Purple Rain Vineyard
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa21313 NE 147th Ave., Brush Prairie, WA, 98606, USAWelcome to Purple Rain Vineyard, a French Potager Garden. We have enjoyed growing organically" for many years and been experimenting with fruit and vegetable varieties for their best flavor. Our CSA program is not simply to provide you with fresh vegetables and fruit every week; it goes deeper into the fundamental reasons. It begins with awareness and ends with a partnership of great food, people, and land. By enjoying better health, celebrating great local food, contributing to a better environment and preserving agricultural land, we make a difference for the present and the future. By designing a potager garden versus a farm, we hold to the basic theory that there must be diversity and smaller concentrations of production interspersed with shelters and sustenance for beneficial insects, and at the same time creating a visually colorful, simplistic and rich landscape and drawing our inner relationship and harmony into the miracle of life.

properties.name: Red Basket Farm CSA
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa23804 NE 182nd Ave., Battle Ground, WA, 98604Wide selection seasonal vegetables, many heirloom varieties. berries and fruit. Flower and pig shares also available.

properties.name: Rising River Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa13208 201st ave, rochester, wa, 98579We grow over 35 different types of vegetables and culinary herbs on 11 fertile acres. Our CSA serves 100 families in Thurston and Lewis counties. We can also be found at the Olympia Farmers Market Thursday through Sunday, May through December. Need pickling cucumbers or bulk quantities of carrots, beets, beans, basil, and others for canning and freezing? Contact us to make a special order to be picked up at the farm or Olympia Farmers Market.

properties.name: Smokey Valley
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa113 Blake Rd., Toledo, WA, 98591Heritage breeds of Sheep...We are breeding 7 breeds of Rare-Endangered-Heritage-Miniature-Small, all Registared sheep. Jacob, Southdown, Black Welch Mountain, Katahdin, Icelandic, Cheviot, Tunis. Raising them with basic family farm methods to be healthly. Selling Breeding stock, Wool, Meat, and Pet stock. We are always increasing the awareness of the plight of the smaller older breeds of farm stock by educating and informing others about the need to save them.

properties.name: Stiebrs Farms, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by SlowfoodswwaStiebrs Farms is a family owned and operated farm located in Western Washington. We have been supplying the freshest,local eggs to our community since 1953. We offer many varieties of Natural Cage Free and Certified 100% Organic Eggs. We also raise Natural Duck Eggs. We mill our own Organic feed in our Certified 100% Organic Feed Mill. Most recently we certified our Beef and Pasture 100% Organic. Contact us for all your Organic Eggs, Organic Beef, and Organic Feed needs! Find out more at www.stiebrsfarms.com Certified Organic by the Washington State Department of Agriculture since 1999

properties.name: Stockhouse's Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa6 west birnie slough rd., Cathlamet, WA, 98612Stockhouse’s Farm on beautiful Puget Island, located in the lower Columbia River, offers a reason to visit year round. Rog’s Retreat, our beautiful guest cottage is available as your rustic getaway. The park like grounds are the perfect backdrop for your wedding or special event. We also offer a wonderful elope package. Diane grows veggie plants for your garden, available beginning May 1st. Rob’s Pumpkin Patch is a must-see in October. The farm is an operating CSA, offering flower and produce subscriptions. Flowers by the bucket from Diane’s burgeoning cutting garden are available for your wedding or special event. And the weekly Two Islands Farm Market held at Stockhouse’s Farm is the place to come to purchase fresh, local food and flowers and visit with your friends and neighbors. Open Fridays 3 p.m. – 6 p.m., May through October.

properties.name: Storytree Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa6227 N.Ef. 124th Street, Vancouver, WA, 98686Nelson\'s legendary vegetable and flower gardens have blossomed into a passion to provide local folks with a wonderful source of fresh, sustainably-grown produce, gourmet salad greens, and premium herbs. We encourage our new subscribers to call and arrange a visit.We firmly believe that local small farms provide a valuable connection between the consumer and his or her food source while providing a safe and healthy alternative to anonymous food from "Corporate Agriculture" and international food sources. Obtaining your family\'s food from a local CSA puts dollars back into your local economy and helps to conserve the earth\'s valuable resources.

properties.name: Valley View Blueberries, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa21717 NE 68th St., Vancouver, WA, 98682Our three-generation blueberry farm is located in the prestine Columbia River Gorge area of Washington state. This beautiful Northwest location provide us with ideal growing conditions for our sweet, lush blueberries. We are certified pesticide free and practice good water conservation and farming practices. Open July and August for fresh and year round for frozen. We do not ship frozen berries, sorry.

properties.name: Vancouver Food Co-op & Buyer's Club
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa Vancouver, WA, 98663, USAWe are a Vancouver, WA group working on opening the first Food Co-op in our area. While we are working hard on the storefront we also have a Buyer\'s Club.

properties.name: Winlock Meadows Farm
properties.description: Posted by Slowfoodswwa186 Tingle Rd., Winlock, WA, 98596Winlock Meadows Farm is a small family farm nestled in rural Southwest Washington. We offer CSA Memberships, sell at Farmer\'s Markets in Olympia, Longview, and Chehalis (new this year, mail-order and we offer a unique alterntive to our CSA program called Click \'n Pick. You can visit our website www.WinlockMeadowsFarm.com for details. We grow a variety of mixed vegetables, including gourmet and heirloom varieties. Our Salad Greens with Edible Flowers are one of our specialities, along with our Stir Fry Mix, and "Knock Your Socks Off" Garlic Basil Dressing. We grow all year outdoors due to the mild winters in the Pacific Northwest, and in our unheated 1800 sq. ft. greenhouse. We have Spring, Summer and Winter memberships, and deliver to Thurston, Lewis and Cowlitz Counties. CSA (Community Supported Agriculture) is a great way to be connected to your local farm. The Local Harvest website is here to connect you to your local CSA farm in your area. If you don\'t buy from our small family farm, buy from someone\'s. Our food security depends upon it. And please visit our farmland preservation website, www.FarmBankProject.com.
